revised_title: The Role of Sulphovinic Acid in the Formation of Ether
tldr: Henry Hennell investigates the mutual action of sulfuric acid and alcohol and the formation of ether. He argues that the formation of sulphovinic acid is a necessary and intermediate step in the production of ether from alcohol and sulfuric acid. This theory is also illustrated by using olefiant gas as the hydrocarbonous base.
